Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and very faint traces of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394788) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394788)
